sentence.Network_en: They regretted agreeing to the convocation of that meeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们后悔同意召开这个会议.

sentence.Network_en: We declared ourselves for the immediate convocation of the meeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们主张立即召开这个会议.

sentence.Network_en: The convocation about environment will be held on next Monday.
sentence.Network_cn: 有关环境的会议将在下周一举行.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ③由其他全基督教会议以明确的语言通过经典教义宣布为异端的行为; ④议会在教牧人员代表会议(Convocation)。同意下确定的行为。 (2)谁来判断异端罪? ①世俗法官.
convivially 欢乐地convocation 集会convocator 会议召集人
the convocation of city university of hong kong ., 香港城市大学评议会.
circumstantial 次要的，详尽的convocation 召集culmination 顶点

list.abs: 第三层分类 ... 大学教师 don 大学毕业典礼 convocation ceremony 女子学校 girls' schools.
Cheer as our pleases the triumphant convocation of Shanghai Expo in 2010 !, 纵情欢呼 2010年上海世博会胜利召开!
修订本利23:4 "以下是你们要按时宣告为圣会的耶和华的节期。" KJV 英利23:4 These are the feasts of the LORD, even holy convocations, which ye shall.
Her idsband is away at an academic convocation when she is suddenly hospitalize ., 她突然住院时她丈夫正在外地参加一个学术会议.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin convocatio(n-), from the verb convocare (see convoke)

entry.def: A convocation is a meeting or ceremony attended by a large number of people.

example.ex: ...a convocation of the American Youth Congress.
example.tran: 美国青年代表大会的会议

means.word_mean: 1. a group gathered in response to a summons

auth_sentence.content: That is, it was a convocation of computer nerds.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is, it was a convocation of computer nerds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is, it was a convocation of computer nerds.

auth_sentence.content: The candidate disinvited Wright from giving the convocation when he announced his Presidential bid.
auth_sentence.res_content: The candidate disinvited Wright from giving the convocation when he announced his Presidential bid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The candidate disinvited Wright from giving the convocation when he announced his Presidential bid.

auth_sentence.content: When he was done, the convocation rose again and cheered him even more thunderously.
auth_sentence.res_content: When he was done, the convocation rose again and cheered him even more thunderously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When he was done, the convocation rose again and cheered him even more thunderously.

stems_affixes.word_buile: equi平等+vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]→两种声音的,听不清楚的→意义含糊的
ir不+revocable可取消的→adj.不可取消的
voci=voc出声,叫喊,看+fer带来+ous……的→带来声音的→喧闹的
advocate拥护+or人→n.拥护者, 提倡者
voc出声,叫喊,看+able能……的→能发出声的→词
vocabul=vocable[n.[无义]词, 词外壳]+ary表名词→n.词汇,词汇量;词汇表
voc出声,叫喊,看+al表名词→n.元音;声乐作品
vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]+ist人→n.流行歌手,声乐家

stems_affixes.value_cn: 职业;召唤;天命;天职;才能
stems_affixes.word_buile: voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→[受到]召唤→天职;职业
vow=voc出声,叫喊,看+el表名词→n.元音；元音字母
con共同+voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→n.召集,会议
ad加强+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→增强声音→拥护
equi平等+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→两种声音听不清楚→支吾其词
